<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>orderedPlacementStrategies?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy&gt;[] | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy&gt;[]&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceOrderedPlacementStrategy&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Service level strategy rules that are taken into consideration during task placement. List
from top to bottom in order of precedence. The maximum number of `ordered_placement_strategy`

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-propagateTags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L300">property <b>propagateTags</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>propagateTags?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition or the service
to the tasks. The valid values are `SERVICE` and `TASK_DEFINITION`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-schedulingStrategy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L307">property <b>schedulingStrategy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>schedulingStrategy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The scheduling strategy to use for the service. The valid values are `REPLICA` and `DAEMON`.
Defaults to `REPLICA`. Note that [*Fargate tasks do not support the `DAEMON` scheduling
strategy*](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/scheduling_tasks.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-securityGroups">

The security groups to use for the instances.

Defaults to [cluster.securityGroups] if unspecified.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-taskDefinitionArgs">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2ServiceArgs-waitForSteadyState">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L326">property <b>waitForSteadyState</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForSteadyState?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Wait for the service to reach a steady state (like [`aws ecs wait
services-stable`](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/ecs/wait/services-stable.html))
before continuing. Defaults to `true`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinition-createExecutionRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L118">method <b>createExecutionRole</b></a>
</h4>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public static </span>createExecutionRole(name: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>, assumeRolePolicy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/iam/#PolicyDocument'>PolicyDocument</a>, policyArns?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>[], opts?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#ComponentResourceOptions'>pulumi.ComponentResourceOptions</a>): <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/iam/#Role'>Role</a></code></pre>


Creates the [executionRole] for a [TaskDefinition] if not provided explicitly. If
[assumeRolePolicy] is provided it will be used when creating the task, otherwise
[defaultRoleAssumeRolePolicy] will be used.  If [policyArns] are provided, they will be used
to create [RolePolicyAttachment]s for the Role.  Otherwise, [defaultExecutionRolePolicyARNs] will
be used.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinition-initialize">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L22">method <b>initialize</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>protected </span>initialize(args: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>): <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TData&gt;</code></pre>


Can be overridden by a subclass to asynchronously initialize data for this Component
automatically when constructed.  The data will be available immediately for subclass
constructors to use.  To access the data use `.getData`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinition-isInstance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L22">method <b>isInstance</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>static </span>isInstance(obj: <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#any'>any</a></span>): obj is <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#ComponentResource'>ComponentResource</a></code></pre>


Returns true if the given object is an instance of CustomResource.  This is designed to work even when
multiple copies of the Pulumi SDK have been loaded into the same process.

</h4>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>protected </span>registerOutputs(outputs?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a> | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>Output</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt;): <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#void'>void</a></span></code></pre>


registerOutputs registers synthetic outputs that a component has initialized, usually by
allocating other child sub-resources and propagating their resulting property values.

ComponentResources can call this at the end of their constructor to indicate that they are
done creating child resources.  This is not strictly necessary as this will automatically be
called after the `initialize` method completes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinition-run">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L48">property <b>run</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>run: (params: <a href='#RunTaskRequest'>RunTaskRequest</a>) => <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;awssdk.ECS.Types.RunTaskResponse&gt;;</code></pre>

Run one or more instances of this TaskDefinition using the ECS `runTask` API, returning the Task instances.

This wrapper around `runTask` provides appropriate defaults based on the TaskDefinition and allows specifying a Cluster instead of individual network configurations.

This API is designed for use at runtime.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs" data-link-title="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L123">
        interface <strong>EC2TaskDefinitionArgs</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>EC2TaskDefinitionArgs</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-container">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L183">property <b>container</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>container?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/awsx/ecs/#Container'>ecs.Container</a>;</code></pre>

Single container to make a TaskDefinition from.  Useful for simple cases where there aren't
multiple containers, especially when creating a TaskDefinition to call [run] on.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-containers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L191">property <b>containers</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>containers?: Record&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>, <a href='#Container'>Container</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

All the containers to make a TaskDefinition from.  Useful when creating a
Service that will contain many containers within.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-executionRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L167">property <b>executionRole</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>executionRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/iam/#Role'>Role</a> | <span class='kd'>null</span>;</code></pre>

The execution role that the Amazon ECS container agent and the Docker daemon can assume.

If `undefined`, a default will be created for the task.  If `null` no role will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-family">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L160">property <b>family</b></a>

An optional family name for the Task Definition. If not specified, then a suitable default will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-logGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L149">property <b>logGroup</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>logGroup?: LogGroup | <span class='kd'>null</span>;</code></pre>

Log group for logging information related to the service.  If `undefined` a default instance
with a one-day retention policy will be created.  If `null` no log group will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-networkMode">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/ec2Service.ts#L173">property <b>networkMode</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>networkMode?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='s2'>"none"</span> | <span class='s2'>"bridge"</span> | <span class='s2'>"awsvpc"</span> | <span class='s2'>"host"</span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The Docker networking mode to use for the containers in the task. The valid values are
`none`, `bridge`, `awsvpc`, and `host`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-placementConstraints">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>placementConstraints?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[] | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[]&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

Maximum number of `placement_constraints` is `10`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="EC2TaskDefinitionArgs-taskRole">

`undefined`, a default will be created for the task.  If `null` no role will be created.

The vpc that the service for this task will run in.  Does not normally need to be explicitly
provided as it will be inferred from the cluster the service is associated with.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateService-registerOutputs">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>protected </span>registerOutputs(outputs?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a> | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>Output</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt;): <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#void'>void</a></span></code></pre>

allocating other child sub-resources and propagating their resulting property values.

ComponentResources can call this at the end of their constructor to indicate that they are
done creating child resources.  This is not strictly necessary as this will automatically be

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-deploymentMaximumPercent">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L362">property <b>deploymentMaximumPercent</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>deploymentMaximumPercent?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The upper limit (as a percentage of the service's desiredCount) of the number of running
tasks that can be running in a service during a deployment. Not valid when using the `DAEMON`
scheduling strategy.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-deploymentMinimumHealthyPercent">

The lower limit (as a percentage of the service's desiredCount) of the number of running
tasks that must remain running and healthy in a service during a deployment.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-desiredCount">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L374">property <b>desiredCount</b></a>

The number of instances of the task definition to place and keep running. Defaults to 1. Do
not specify if using the `DAEMON` scheduling strategy.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L385">property <b>healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Seconds to ignore failing load balancer health checks on newly instantiated tasks to prevent
premature shutdown, up to 7200. Only valid for services configured to use load balancers.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-iamRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L395">property <b>iamRole</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>iamRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

ARN of the IAM role that allows Amazon ECS to make calls to your load balancer on your
behalf. This parameter is required if you are using a load balancer with your service, but
only if your task definition does not use the `awsvpc` network mode. If using `awsvpc`
network mode, do not specify this role. If your account has already created the Amazon ECS
service-linked role, that role is used by default for your service unless you specify a role
here.

A load balancer block. Load balancers documented below.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-platformVersion">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-propagateTags">

Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition or the service
to the tasks. The valid values are `SERVICE` and `TASK_DEFINITION`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-schedulingStrategy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L453">property <b>schedulingStrategy</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>schedulingStrategy?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The scheduling strategy to use for the service. The valid values are `REPLICA` and `DAEMON`.
Defaults to `REPLICA`. Note that [*Fargate tasks do not support the `DAEMON` scheduling
strategy*](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/scheduling_tasks.html).

The security groups to use for the instances.

Defaults to [cluster.securityGroups] if unspecified.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-subnets">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L426">property <b>subnets</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>subnets?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The subnets to connect the instances to.  If unspecified and [assignPublicIp] is true, then
these will be the public subnets of the cluster's vpc.  If unspecified and [assignPublicIp]
is false, then these will be the private subnets of the cluster's vpc.

Key-value mapping of resource tags

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-taskDefinition">

The task definition to create the service from.  Either [taskDefinition] or
[taskDefinitionArgs] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-taskDefinitionArgs">

[taskDefinitionArgs] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateServiceArgs-waitForSteadyState">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L480">property <b>waitForSteadyState</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>waitForSteadyState?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Wait for the service to reach a steady state (like [`aws ecs wait
services-stable`](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/ecs/wait/services-stable.html))
before continuing. Defaults to `true`.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="FargateTaskDefinition" data-link-title="FargateTaskDefinition">

    </a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>class</span> <span class='nx'>FargateTaskDefinition</span> <span class='kr'>extends</span> <a href='#TaskDefinition'>TaskDefinition</a></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinition-constructor">

</h4>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinition-createExecutionRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L118">method <b>createExecutionRole</b></a>
</h4>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public static </span>createExecutionRole(name: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>, assumeRolePolicy?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span> | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/iam/#PolicyDocument'>PolicyDocument</a>, policyArns?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>[], opts?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#ComponentResourceOptions'>pulumi.ComponentResourceOptions</a>): <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/iam/#Role'>Role</a></code></pre>


Creates the [executionRole] for a [TaskDefinition] if not provided explicitly. If
[assumeRolePolicy] is provided it will be used when creating the task, otherwise
[defaultRoleAssumeRolePolicy] will be used.  If [policyArns] are provided, they will be used
to create [RolePolicyAttachment]s for the Role.  Otherwise, [defaultExecutionRolePolicyARNs] will
be used.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinition-initialize">

Can be overridden by a subclass to asynchronously initialize data for this Component
automatically when constructed.  The data will be available immediately for subclass
constructors to use.  To access the data use `.getData`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinition-isInstance">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L22">method <b>isInstance</b></a>
</h4>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>static </span>isInstance(obj: <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#any'>any</a></span>): obj is <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#ComponentResource'>ComponentResource</a></code></pre>


Returns true if the given object is an instance of CustomResource.  This is designed to work even when

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinition-registerOutputs">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L22">method <b>registerOutputs</b></a>
</h4>


<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>protected </span>registerOutputs(outputs?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a> | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Output'>Output</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Inputs'>Inputs</a>&gt;): <span class='kd'><a href='https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/basic-types.html#void'>void</a></span></code></pre>


registerOutputs registers synthetic outputs that a component has initialized, usually by
allocating other child sub-resources and propagating their resulting property values.

ComponentResources can call this at the end of their constructor to indicate that they are
done creating child resources.  This is not strictly necessary as this will automatically be
called after the `initialize` method completes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinition-run">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L48">property <b>run</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public </span>run: (params: <a href='#RunTaskRequest'>RunTaskRequest</a>) => <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;awssdk.ECS.Types.RunTaskResponse&gt;;</code></pre>

Run one or more instances of this TaskDefinition using the ECS `runTask` API, returning the Task instances.

This wrapper around `runTask` provides appropriate defaults based on the TaskDefinition and allows specifying a Cluster instead of individual network configurations.

This API is designed for use at runtime.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs" data-link-title="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs">
    <a href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L256">
        interface <strong>FargateTaskDefinitionArgs</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>FargateTaskDefinitionArgs</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-container">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L320">property <b>container</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>container?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/awsx/ecs/#Container'>ecs.Container</a>;</code></pre>

Single container to make a TaskDefinition from.  Useful for simple cases where there aren't
multiple containers, especially when creating a TaskDefinition to call [run] on.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-containers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L328">property <b>containers</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>containers?: Record&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>, <a href='#Container'>Container</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

All the containers to make a TaskDefinition from.  Useful when creating a Service that will
contain many containers within.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-cpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L306">property <b>cpu</b></a>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cpu?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of cpu units used by the task.  If not provided, a default will be computed
based on the cumulative needs specified by [containerDefinitions]

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-executionRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L300">property <b>executionRole</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>executionRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/iam/#Role'>Role</a> | <span class='kd'>null</span>;</code></pre>

The execution role that the Amazon ECS container agent and the Docker daemon can assume.

 If `undefined`, a default will be created for the task.  If `null` no role will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-family">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L293">property <b>family</b></a>

An optional family name for the Task Definition. If not specified, then a suitable default will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-logGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L282">property <b>logGroup</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>logGroup?: LogGroup | <span class='kd'>null</span>;</code></pre>

Log group for logging information related to the service.  If `undefined` a default instance
with a one-day retention policy will be created.  If `null` no log group will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-memory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/fargateService.ts#L312">property <b>memory</b></a>

The amount (in MiB) of memory used by the task.  If not provided, a default will be computed
based on the cumulative needs specified by [containerDefinitions]

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-placementConstraints">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>placementConstraints?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[] | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[]&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-taskRole">

IAM role that allows your Amazon ECS container task to make calls to other AWS services. If
`undefined`, a default will be created for the task.  If `null` no role will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="FargateTaskDefinitionArgs-volumes">

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'>public static </span>fromDockerBuild(name: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>, build: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;DockerBuild&gt;): <a href='#Image'>Image</a></code></pre>

Either a [name] or [repository] needs to be provided where the built image will be pushed

created on-demand, using the [name] value.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="NetworkConfiguration-securityGroups">

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="RunTaskRequest" data-link-title="RunTaskRequest">

        interface <strong>RunTaskRequest</strong>
    </a>
</h3>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kr'>interface</span> <span class='nx'>RunTaskRequest</span></code></pre>
<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-cluster">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L166">property <b>cluster</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cluster: <a href='#Cluster'>Cluster</a>;</code></pre>

The Cluster to run the Task within.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-count">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L174">property <b>count</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>count?: awssdk.ECS.BoxedInteger;</code></pre>

The number of instantiations of the specified task to place on your cluster. You can specify up to 10 tasks per call.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-enableECSManagedTags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L206">property <b>enableECSManagedTags</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>enableECSManagedTags?: awssdk.ECS.Boolean;</code></pre>

Specifies whether to enable Amazon ECS managed tags for the task. For more information, see Tagging Your Amazon ECS Resources in the Amazon Elastic Container Service Developer Guide.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-group">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L182">property <b>group</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>group?: awssdk.ECS.String;</code></pre>

The name of the task group to associate with the task. The default value is the family name of the task definition (for example, family:my-family-name).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-networkConfiguration">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L198">property <b>networkConfiguration</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>networkConfiguration?: awssdk.ECS.NetworkConfiguration;</code></pre>

The network configuration for the task. This parameter is required for task definitions that use the awsvpc network mode to receive their own elastic network interface, and it is not supported for other network modes. For more information, see Task Networking in the Amazon Elastic Container Service Developer Guide.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-overrides">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L170">property <b>overrides</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>overrides?: awssdk.ECS.TaskOverride;</code></pre>

A list of container overrides in JSON format that specify the name of a container in the specified task definition and the overrides it should receive. You can override the default command for a container (that is specified in the task definition or Docker image) with a command override. You can also override existing environment variables (that are specified in the task definition or Docker image) on a container or add new environment variables to it with an environment override.  A total of 8192 characters are allowed for overrides. This limit includes the JSON formatting characters of the override structure.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-placementConstraints">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L186">property <b>placementConstraints</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>placementConstraints?: awssdk.ECS.PlacementConstraints;</code></pre>

An array of placement constraint objects to use for the task. You can specify up to 10 constraints per task (including constraints in the task definition and those specified at runtime).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-placementStrategy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L190">property <b>placementStrategy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>placementStrategy?: awssdk.ECS.PlacementStrategies;</code></pre>

The placement strategy objects to use for the task. You can specify a maximum of five strategy rules per task.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-platformVersion">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L194">property <b>platformVersion</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>platformVersion?: awssdk.ECS.String;</code></pre>

The platform version the task should run. A platform version is only specified for tasks using the Fargate launch type. If one is not specified, the LATEST platform version is used by default. For more information, see AWS Fargate Platform Versions in the Amazon Elastic Container Service Developer Guide.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-propagateTags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L210">property <b>propagateTags</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>propagateTags?: awssdk.ECS.PropagateTags;</code></pre>

Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition or the service to the task. If no value is specified, the tags are not propagated.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-startedBy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L178">property <b>startedBy</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>startedBy?: awssdk.ECS.String;</code></pre>

An optional tag specified when a task is started. For example, if you automatically trigger a task to run a batch process job, you could apply a unique identifier for that job to your task with the startedBy parameter. You can then identify which tasks belong to that job by filtering the results of a ListTasks call with the startedBy value. Up to 36 letters (uppercase and lowercase), numbers, hyphens, and underscores are allowed. If a task is started by an Amazon ECS service, then the startedBy parameter contains the deployment ID of the service that starts it.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="RunTaskRequest-tags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L202">property <b>tags</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>tags?: awssdk.ECS.Tags;</code></pre>

The metadata that you apply to the task to help you categorize and organize them. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define. Tag keys can have a maximum character length of 128 characters, and tag values can have a maximum length of 256 characters.

<h3 class="pdoc-module-header" id="ServiceArgs" data-link-title="ServiceArgs">

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>capacityProviderStrategies?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy&gt;[] | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy&gt;[]&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceCapacityProviderStrategy&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

The capacity provider strategy to use for the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-cluster">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L290">property <b>cluster</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cluster?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/awsx/ecs/#Cluster'>ecs.Cluster</a>;</code></pre>

Cluster this service will run in.  If not specified [Cluster.getDefault()] will be used.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-deploymentController">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L182">property <b>deploymentController</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>deploymentController?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | ServiceDeploymentController | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;ServiceDeploymentController&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;ServiceDeploymentController&gt;;</code></pre>

onfiguration block containing deployment controller configuration.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-deploymentMaximumPercent">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L189">property <b>deploymentMaximumPercent</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>deploymentMaximumPercent?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The upper limit (as a percentage of the service's desiredCount) of the number of running
tasks that can be running in a service during a deployment. Not valid when using the `DAEMON`
scheduling strategy.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-deploymentMinimumHealthyPercent">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L195">property <b>deploymentMinimumHealthyPercent</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>deploymentMinimumHealthyPercent?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The lower limit (as a percentage of the service's desiredCount) of the number of running
tasks that must remain running and healthy in a service during a deployment.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-desiredCount">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L201">property <b>desiredCount</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>desiredCount?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of instances of the task definition to place and keep running. Defaults to 1. Do
not specify if using the `DAEMON` scheduling strategy.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-enableEcsManagedTags">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L206">property <b>enableEcsManagedTags</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>enableEcsManagedTags?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Boolean'>boolean</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Specifies whether to enable Amazon ECS managed tags for the tasks within the service.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L212">property <b>healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>healthCheckGracePeriodSeconds?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Number'>number</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

Seconds to ignore failing load balancer health checks on newly instantiated tasks to prevent
premature shutdown, up to 7200. Only valid for services configured to use load balancers.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-iamRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L222">property <b>iamRole</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>iamRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

ARN of the IAM role that allows Amazon ECS to make calls to your load balancer on your
behalf. This parameter is required if you are using a load balancer with your service, but
only if your task definition does not use the `awsvpc` network mode. If using `awsvpc`
network mode, do not specify this role. If your account has already created the Amazon ECS
service-linked role, that role is used by default for your service unless you specify a role
here.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-launchType">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L228">property <b>launchType</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>launchType?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='s2'>"EC2"</span> | <span class='s2'>"FARGATE"</span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The launch type on which to run your service. The valid values are `EC2` and `FARGATE`.
Defaults to `EC2`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-networkConfiguration">

The network configuration for the service. This parameter is required for task definitions
that use the `awsvpc` network mode to receive their own Elastic Network Interface, and it is
not supported for other network modes.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-platformVersion">

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-propagateTags">

Specifies whether to propagate the tags from the task definition or the service
to the tasks. The valid values are `SERVICE` and `TASK_DEFINITION`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="ServiceArgs-schedulingStrategy">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/service.ts#L278">property <b>schedulingStrategy</b></a>

The scheduling strategy to use for the service. The valid values are `REPLICA` and `DAEMON`.
Defaults to `REPLICA`. Note that [*Fargate tasks do not support the `DAEMON` scheduling
strategy*](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonECS/latest/developerguide/scheduling_tasks.html).

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-containers">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L367">property <b>containers</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>containers: Record&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>, <a href='#Container'>Container</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

ClusterService that will contain many containers within.

Either [container] or [containers] must be provided.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-cpu">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L342">property <b>cpu</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>cpu?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The number of cpu units used by the task.  If not provided, a default will be computed
based on the cumulative needs specified by [containerDefinitions]

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-executionRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L331">property <b>executionRole</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>executionRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/iam/#Role'>Role</a> | <span class='kd'>null</span>;</code></pre>

The execution role that the Amazon ECS container agent and the Docker daemon can assume.

If `undefined`, a default will be created for the task.  If `null`, no task will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-family">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L336">property <b>family</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>family?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

An optional family name for the Task Definition. If not specified, then a suitable default will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-logGroup">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L318">property <b>logGroup</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>logGroup?: LogGroup | <span class='kd'>null</span>;</code></pre>

Log group for logging information related to the service.  If `undefined` a default instance
with a one-day retention policy will be created.  If `null`, no log group will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-memory">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L348">property <b>memory</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>memory?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/String'>string</a></span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The amount (in MiB) of memory used by the task.  If not provided, a default will be computed
based on the cumulative needs specified by [containerDefinitions]

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-networkMode">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L359">property <b>networkMode</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>networkMode?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<span class='s2'>"none"</span> | <span class='s2'>"bridge"</span> | <span class='s2'>"awsvpc"</span> | <span class='s2'>"host"</span>&gt;;</code></pre>

The Docker networking mode to use for the containers in the task. The valid values are
`none`, `bridge`, `awsvpc`, and `host`.

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>placementConstraints?: <span class='kd'><a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/undefined'>undefined</a></span> | TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[] | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[]&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint | <a href='https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Promise'>Promise</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt; | <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#OutputInstance'>OutputInstance</a>&lt;TaskDefinitionPlacementConstraint&gt;[]&gt;;</code></pre>

A set of placement constraints rules that are taken into consideration during task placement.
Maximum number of `placement_constraints` is `10`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-requiresCompatibilities">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L353">property <b>requiresCompatibilities</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>requiresCompatibilities: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;[, <span class='s2'>"FARGATE"</span>] | [, <span class='s2'>"EC2"</span>]&gt;;</code></pre>

A set of launch types required by the task. The valid values are `EC2` and `FARGATE`.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-tags">

</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>tags?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/pulumi/#Input'>pulumi.Input</a>&lt;<a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/#Tags'>Tags</a>&gt;;</code></pre>

Key-value mapping of resource tags

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-taskRole">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L324">property <b>taskRole</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>taskRole?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/aws/iam/#Role'>Role</a> | <span class='kd'>null</span>;</code></pre>

IAM role that allows your Amazon ECS container task to make calls to other AWS services. If
`undefined`, a default will be created for the task.  If `null`, no task will be created.

<h4 class="pdoc-member-header" id="TaskDefinitionArgs-vpc">
<a class="pdoc-child-name" href="https://github.com/pulumi/pulumi-awsx/blob/{{< param git_sha >}}/nodejs/awsx/ecs/taskDefinition.ts#L299">property <b>vpc</b></a>
</h4>

<pre class="highlight"><code><span class='kd'></span>vpc?: <a href='/docs/reference/pkg/nodejs/pulumi/awsx/ec2/#Vpc'>x.ec2.Vpc</a>;</code></pre>

The vpc that the service for this task will run in.  Does not normally need to be explicitly
provided as it will be inferred from the cluster the service is associated with.
